title: The kog'maw revert... you missed a spot
body: It's a simple request but the old kog'maw's bio-arcane barrage costed no mana and this was not reverted in the revert.  Considering that certain items that used to be core on him have been nerfed since then (cough cough bork) and how weak his laning phase already is could you please give him that small amount of power back? It seems fair to me.

It's more an evaluation of how much negative impact it was having on the game.

AP Kog only got one direct nerf (R damage and stack limit from 6 to 8) when Athenes was first released.  Which makes sense.  Athenes plus AA basically removed Kog's mana gating, which was what kept AP Kog balanced.  He was used, sometimes he was pretty good, but he was never any more of a dominating force than any other Mage in the game.

The problem is Riot often seems bent on designing around 'is it fun to lose against' rather than 'is it fun to play'.  This philosophy has lead largely to a lack of hard counters (because getting hard countered is frustrating) and strongly defined niches (because people don't automatically own all champions), which is why we only ever see a dozenish champions spammed all the time.

The old AP Kog had very clear weaknesses (end the game early, split push, super hard engage) but if your team wasn't set up to deal with him, there was a good chance you were going to lose.  Is that kind of design good?  Or should all champions do more or less the same thing such that only the current 'best' jacks of all trade are picked again and again?  It isn't so much a question of balance as it is a question of game design.

Who's fun is more important?  The person losing because they counter-picked themselves?  Or the person playing the niche champion?  Who should be getting rewarded for good decision making?

Ideally everyone gets to have fun, or at least that's one of Riot's goals. Personally I don't think old AP Kog had enough weaknesses in soloq. His early game was hard to punish because his wave clear out pushed a large amount of mid laners. Then he eventually scaled into a monster that pushed you off of objectives if you couldn't instantly dive him from fog of war and kill him. I hated playing against him, and I'm glad to see him awful. I do like that Riot is trying to make sure that you can always do something in a game, and therefor never get hard countered as I don't want to play a 20-40 minute game in which I do nothing simply because my opponent hard counter picked me after I picked my champ. At that point you may as well dodge instead of playing it out.

As much as I loved playing against AP Kog (I didn't) I can see why it was not reverted. AP Kog had ano extremely easy laning phase after level 7 and tear  (wasn't even that bad before that either) since E+R guarenteed casters and you can fairly easily last hit everything else with W (all for like 140 mana tops since W was 0) and he easily got his Rylais and proceeded to permaslow nuke people from off the screen.

The poke itself wasn't that much of a problem. The problem was Kog was one of the champions in the game that breaks Rylais because it removes any difficulty required to land his ult, if you hit 1 the chances of you hitting more was extremely high since they are slowed by 40% and you have vision. A rather farmed AP Kog (which was NOT hard as seen above) basically had a Jhin ult that couldn't be blocked, didn't really have a cooldown, and the max range constantly moved since Kog doesn't root himself.
So once again it's not the champ it's Rylai's

I mean there is no way to tune Rylais around the problem interactions (Viktor, Azir, Kog R, etc.) without removing it from the game since the only 2 options are simply reducing the slow for these problems (which hits the entire roster arguably harder than these champions who also have a plethora of other items to choose from unlike say Brand who has to buy it every single game) or reducing the slow duration (which yet again doesn't hurt these problems since they either reapply it faster than any duration can be like Azir or it is CLOSE enough that the small duration slow is enough to chain hit such as Viktor E/R or Kog R).

But it did have counterplay any engage or assassin easily handled kogmaw. Its kinda like xerath or ziggs, if you let them sit back and barrage you team with q, etc.. then yea you are gonna lose but if you have good engage or mobility and burst, you can delete them. At least kog'maw only had slows xerath has slows and a stun while ziggs has a knockback and a slow. Imo kog should be fully reverted because he wasn't even oppressive when they reworked him.

We talked a lot about whether or not we should go back to a zero mana cost W on Kog. We decided not to in 6.19 at least both to get a better understanding of where Kog's power level would end up post partial revert and because of some concerns about the impact of a no cost W. It was a change we were never entirely happy with, given it both changes the meaning of what mana/being OOM mean on a kit and added quite a bit of laning power to a champion intended to have a lot of late game strength. It's certainly possible we add go back to it if Kog needs buffs after these changes, might be other buffs though that are better options. 

In terms of possible changes in 6.20 we're waiting to see how Kog performs over the next few days at least before we talk about whether we should try and do anything power wise in the next patch or not. We will definitely be changing his W animation back to the pre-update one, that's basically just a feel change though, so doesn't need to take his balance state into account.

Vayne's deals more damage to anything above 120 MR even including Kog's %Resist shred.  With her Ult active Vayne out-damages Kog no questions asked.  On paper Kog's W seems crazy powerful, but because it only scales linearly with attack speed it drops off in the late game.  Kog was always at his most powerful once Trinity was finished and started leveling out from there.

He's not a late game hyper carry.  He's a mid-game carry who doesn't drop off very much in the late game.  So he's stronger in the late game than early bullies, but when compared to the true hyper-carries like Vayne and Twitch he's less successful.  The reason 'protect the Kog' works is because Koggy's long range makes him a little easier to protect than champs like Vayne who have to be a fair bit closer to the action to be truly effective.

He had tons of poke and easy Trinity force procs to make up for his immobility and low health.  But it doesn't look like he's getting either back.


That being said, I have really, really missed old Kog and I never would have dreamed we would even get this much of him back.  So **thank you**.  I know riot hates reverts and normally tends towards a new rework.

Considering Jinx needs to be consistently protected in the same sense as Kog'Maw, being a late game hyper-carry, she is also heavily gated by her Mana costs when using rockets consistently. The only difference being Jinx provides slightly more Utility, for slightly less damage. Unlike Kog, without getting consistent resets Jinx can fall off in the middle of a team fight. The significant difference between Kog'Maw to Jinx and Ashe, is that unlike them, he does not require pre-set up in order to access his damage steroid. 6% max health damage is A LOT, and considering he can access it simply by pressing W, is enough to warrant a mana cost. 
The only work-around the inevitability of going OOM as Jinx is to build a Essence Reaver, which one doesn't fit well in Jinx's kit and two, does not provide 3x the Mana for a Runaan's hurricane Crit. 

Going OOM as Kog, because you over-used your Ultimate foolishly is meant to be punishing, being able to use W freely just because, is something that is best avoided when looking into game health.  There is a reason why Mana-champs are often nuisances in URF, is because they lack the barrier that would normally gate their kit.

When is the last time you ran out of mana on Jinx?  Seriously?  Mana isn't even a thing for most champions this season.  Even if you only use rockets for days. Even when Jinx runs out of mana (which never happens) she still gets to keep her minigun steroid because it doesn't cost any mana.

The main difference is that Kog has destinct windows of power and that Jinx is always flexible.  As a reward for that flexibility, Kog can deal ℅ max health damage and has ℅ armor shred.  All Jinx has is flat damage.


Also, I still don't understand why everyone is pretending like old AD kog'maws auto steriod not costing mana would cause a problem.   It never caused problems before.  This is not a rework.  It's a revert with for nerfs to a champion that was sub par before they reworked it.
